entries.name: Abacus
entries.description: A calculating tool using beads on rods for arithmetic.

entries.name: Acid (vial)
entries.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this vial onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw the vial up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the acid as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage.

entries.name: Alchemist's Fire (flask)
entries.description: This sticky, adhesive fluid ignites when exposed to air. As an action, you can throw this flask up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a creature or object, treating the alchemist's fire as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1d4 fire damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can end this damage by using its action to make a DC 10 Dexterity check to extinguish the flames.

data.effect: 1d4 fire damage per turn until extinguished (DC 10 Dexterity check)

entries.name: Antitoxin (vial)
entries.description: A creature that drinks this vial of liquid gains advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour. It confers no benefit to undead or constructs.

data.effect: Advantage on saving throws against poison for 1 hour

entries.name: Backpack
entries.description: A backpack can hold 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear. You can also strap items, such as a bedroll or a coil of rope, to the outside of a backpack.

entries.name: Ball Bearings (bag of 1,000)
entries.description: As an action, you can spill these tiny metal balls from their pouch to cover a level, square area that is 10 feet on a side. A creature moving across the covered area must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

data.effect: DC 10 Dexterity save or fall prone in 10 ft square

entries.name: Barrel
entries.description: A barrel can hold 40 gallons of liquid or 4 cubic feet of solid material.

entries.name: Basket
entries.description: A basket can hold 2 cubic feet or 40 pounds of gear.

entries.name: Bedroll
entries.description: A sleeping pad and blankets bundled together for sleeping outdoors.

entries.name: Bell
entries.description: A small bell that can be attached to a door, creature, or object to alert you to movement.

entries.name: Blanket
entries.description: A thick, warm blanket suitable for sleeping outdoors or providing warmth.

entries.name: Block and Tackle
entries.description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects, a block and tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

entries.name: Book
entries.description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

entries.name: Bottle, glass
entries.description: A glass bottle can hold 1.5 pints of liquid.

entries.name: Bucket
entries.description: A bucket can hold 3 gallons of liquid or half a cubic foot of solid material.

entries.name: Caltrops (bag of 20)
entries.description: As an action, you can spread a bag of caltrops to cover a square area that is 5 feet on a side. Any creature that enters the area must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or stop moving this turn and take 1 piercing damage. Taking this damage reduces the creature's walking speed by 10 feet until the creature regains at least 1 hit point. A creature moving through the area at half speed doesn't need to make the save.

data.effect: DC 15 Dexterity save or 1 piercing damage and -10 ft speed in 5 ft square

entries.name: Candle
entries.description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 5 feet.

data.effect: 5 ft bright light, 5 ft dim light for 1 hour

entries.name: Case, crossbow bolt
entries.description: This wooden case can hold up to twenty crossbow bolts.

entries.name: Case, map or scroll
entries.description: This cylindrical leather case can hold up to ten rolled-up sheets of paper or five rolled-up sheets of parchment.

entries.name: Chain (10 feet)
entries.description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

entries.name: Chalk (1 piece)
entries.description: A piece of chalk for marking surfaces, drawing diagrams, or leaving messages.

entries.name: Chest
entries.description: A chest can hold 12 cubic feet or 300 pounds of gear.

entries.name: Climber's Kit
entries.description: A climber's kit includes special pitons, boot tips, gloves, and a harness. You can use the climber's kit as an action to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the point where you anchored yourself, and you can't climb more than 25 feet away from that point without undoing the anchor.

entries.name: Component Pouch
entries.description: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost.

entries.name: Crowbar
entries.description: Using a crowbar grants advantage to Strength checks where the crowbar's leverage can be applied.

entries.name: Flask or tankard
entries.description: A flask or tankard can hold 1 pint of liquid.

entries.name: Grappling Hook
entries.description: A grappling hook can secure a rope to a battlement, window ledge, tree limb, or other protrusion.

entries.name: Hammer
entries.description: A hammer is useful for pounding pitons into a wall, demolition, or as an improvised weapon.

entries.name: Healer's Kit
entries.description: This kit is a leather pouch containing bandages, salves, and splints. The kit has ten uses. As an action, you can expend one use of the kit to stabilize a creature that has 0 hit points, without needing to make a Wisdom (Medicine) check.

data.effect: Stabilize a creature at 0 hit points without a Medicine check

entries.name: Holy Water (flask)
entries.description: As an action, you can splash the contents of this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. In either case, make a ranged attack against a target creature, treating the holy water as an improvised weapon. If the target is a fiend or undead, it takes 2d6 radiant damage. A cleric or paladin may create holy water by performing a special ritual. The ritual takes 1 hour to perform, uses 25 gp worth of powdered silver, and requires the caster to expend a 1st-level spell slot.

data.effect: 2d6 radiant damage to fiends and undead

entries.name: Hourglass
entries.description: An hourglass measures time by the flow of sand through glass bulbs.

entries.name: Hunting Trap
entries.description: When you use your action to set it, this trap forms a saw-toothed steel ring that snaps shut when a creature steps on a pressure plate in the center. The trap is affixed by a heavy chain to an immobile object, such as a tree or a spike driven into the ground. A creature that steps on the plate must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw or take 1d4 piercing damage and stop moving. Thereafter, until the creature breaks free of the trap, its movement is limited by the length of the chain (typically 3 feet long). A creature can use its action to make a DC 13 Strength check, freeing itself or another creature within its reach on a success. Each failed check deals 1 piercing damage to the trapped creature.

data.effect: DC 13 Dexterity save or 1d4 piercing damage and restrained

entries.name: Ink (1 ounce bottle)
entries.description: A bottle of ink for writing with an ink pen.

entries.name: Ink Pen
entries.description: A pen for writing with ink, typically made from a quill or reed.

entries.name: Jug or pitcher
entries.description: A jug or pitcher can hold 1 gallon of liquid.

entries.name: Ladder (10-foot)
entries.description: A wooden ladder 10 feet long.

entries.name: Lamp
entries.description: A lamp casts bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

data.effect: 15 ft bright light, 30 ft dim light for 6 hours per flask of oil

entries.name: Lantern, bullseye
entries.description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

data.effect: 60 ft cone bright light, 60 ft cone dim light for 6 hours per flask of oil

entries.name: Lantern, hooded
entries.description: A hooded lantern casts bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil. As an action, you can lower the hood, reducing the light to dim light in a 5-foot radius.

data.effect: 30 ft bright light, 30 ft dim light (or 5 ft dim when hooded) for 6 hours per flask of oil

entries.name: Lock
entries.description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Your GM may decide that better locks are available for higher prices.

entries.name: Manacles
entries.description: These metal restraints can bind a Small or Medium creature. Escaping the manacles requires a successful DC 20 Dexterity check. Breaking them requires a successful DC 20 Strength check. Each set of manacles comes with one key. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick the manacles' lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check. Manacles have 15 hit points.

entries.name: Mess Kit
entries.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

entries.name: Mirror, steel
entries.description: A polished steel mirror, useful for looking around corners, signaling, checking for invisible creatures, or personal grooming.

entries.name: Oil (flask)
entries.description: Oil usually comes in a clay flask that holds 1 pint. As an action, you can splash the oil in this flask onto a creature within 5 feet of you or throw it up to 20 feet, shattering it on impact. Make a ranged attack against a target creature or object, treating the oil as an improvised weapon. On a hit, the target is covered in oil. If the target takes any fire damage before the oil dries (after 1 minute), the target takes an additional 5 fire damage from the burning oil. You can also pour a flask of oil on the ground to cover a 5-foot-square area, provided that the surface is level. If lit, the oil burns for 2 rounds and deals 5 fire damage to any creature that enters the area or ends its turn in the area. A creature can take this damage only once per turn.

data.effect: 5 fire damage when ignited, or fuel for lamps/lanterns (6 hours)

entries.name: Paper (one sheet)
entries.description: A single sheet of paper for writing or drawing.

entries.name: Parchment (one sheet)
entries.description: A single sheet of parchment for writing or drawing.

entries.name: Piton
entries.description: A metal spike that can be driven into a wall or other surface to support a rope.

entries.name: Poison, basic (vial)
entries.description: You can use the poison in this vial to coat one slashing or piercing weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition. Applying the poison takes an action. A creature hit by the poisoned weapon or ammunition must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 1d4 poison damage. Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying.

data.effect: DC 10 Constitution save or 1d4 poison damage (lasts 1 minute)

entries.name: Pole (10-foot)
entries.description: A wooden pole 10 feet long, useful for poking, probing, pushing, or as an improvised weapon.

entries.name: Pot, iron
entries.description: An iron pot for cooking over a fire.

entries.name: Pouch
entries.description: A cloth or leather pouch can hold up to 20 sling bullets or 50 blowgun needles, among other things. A compartmentalized pouch for holding spell components is called a component pouch. A pouch can hold 1/5 cubic foot or 6 pounds of gear.

entries.name: Quiver
entries.description: A quiver can hold up to 20 arrows.

entries.name: Ram, portable
entries.description: You can use a portable ram to break down doors. When doing so, you gain a +4 bonus on the Strength check. One other character can help you use the ram, giving you advantage on this check.

entries.name: Rations (1 day)
entries.description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

entries.name: Rope, hempen (50 feet)
entries.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

entries.name: Rope, silk (50 feet)
entries.description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check. Silk rope is lighter and more expensive than hemp rope.

entries.name: Sack
entries.description: A sack can hold 1 cubic foot or 30 pounds of gear.

entries.name: Sealing wax
entries.description: Wax for sealing letters and documents.

entries.name: Shovel
entries.description: A shovel for digging holes, trenches, or earthworks.

entries.name: Spellbook
entries.description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

entries.name: Spyglass
entries.description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.

entries.name: Tent, two-person
entries.description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

entries.name: Tinderbox
entries.description: This small container holds flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a torch—or anything else with abundant, exposed fuel—takes an action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

entries.name: Torch
entries.description: A torch burns for 1 hour, providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. If you make a melee attack with a burning torch and hit, it deals 1 fire damage.

data.effect: 20 ft bright light, 20 ft dim light for 1 hour

entries.name: Vial
entries.description: A vial can hold 4 ounces of liquid.

entries.name: Waterskin
entries.description: A waterskin can hold 4 pints of liquid.

entries.name: Whetstone
entries.description: A stone for sharpening bladed weapons and tools.
